snippet: For true shard collectors, the more interesting finds are in the weedier parts of the Northeast, where slag heaps and demolition debris survive from the long vanished factories that once thrived.
abstract: Northeastern part of United States provides so-called shard hunters, collectors looking for pieces of colored glass and molded ceramics that once decorated America's skyline, with interesting finds near long-closed factories where they were once produced.
lead_paragraph: For true shard collectors, the more interesting finds are in the weedier parts of the Northeast, where slag heaps and demolition debris survive from the long vanished factories that once thrived.

headline.seo: Collectors Find Historical Value in Broken Glass
headline.main: Fragments of History That Fit in a Pocket
headline.print_headline: Fragments of History That Fit in a Pocket
